questions.question_text: Which three types of patches and upgrades are supported for Oracle Grid Infrastructure 12c? (Choose three.)

choices.D: out-of-place upgrades using the Oracle Universal Installer
choices.A: in-place upgrades using the Oracle Universal Installer

discussion.content: C, D, E - bp only in-place

Selected Answer: AD
A and D

choices.E: You cannot create a nested subdirectory /USERS/2014 under USERS with a single CREATE DIRETORY command even if directory USER1 doesn’t exist.
choices.C: You cannot drop a directory containing aliases unless you delete the aliases first.
choices.A: You can create subdirectories under the USERS directory.
choices.D: You cannot create a user-defined directory at the root (+) level.
choices.B: You cannot rename a user-created subdirectory.

questions.question_text:
A directory +DATA/ORCL/DATAFILE/USERS exists in ASM.
USERS is a user created directory; ORCL and DATAFILE are system generated directories.
Which two statements are true about user-created directories?

choices.F: The reboot advisory broadcasts reboot decisions only over the interconnect.
choices.B: A node whose performance is severely degraded can be evicted.
choices.A: All node evictions require that the evicted node or nodes be rebooted.
choices.C: The OCSSD process may evict a node after an escalation request from a database instance LMON process.
choices.D: The CSSDMONITOR process can request a node eviction.
choices.E: The OCLSKD process is used for node eviction requests originating on the node to be evicted.

questions.answer_description:
D: The cssdagent and cssdmonitor provide the following services to guarantee data integrity:
✑ Monitors the CSS daemon; if the CSS daemon stops, then it shuts down the node
✑ Monitors the node scheduling to verify that the node is not hung, and shuts down the node on recovery from a hang.
Note If the Oracle Clusterware itself is working perfectly but one of the RAC instances is hanging , the database LMON process will request a member kill escalation and ask the CSS process to remove the hanging database instance from the cluster.
On a Linux/Unix system CSS consists of ocssd.bin, cssdmonitor, and cssdagent.
E: Cluster kill daemon (oclskd) handles instance/node evictions requests that have been escalated to the Cluster Synchronization Service (CSS).
Incorrect Answers:
C: Ocssd manages cluster node membership and runs as the oracle user; failure of this process results in a node restart.
questions.question_text: Which three statements are true concerning node evictions and reboots performed by Oracle Clusterware 12c?

discussion.content: B,C,D - oclskd - used by CSS to reboot node based on requests from other nodes in the cluster not from failed node

questions.question_text:
You must replace a failed disk that was dropped from a disk group.
You want the rebalance operation to occur with minimal performance impact.
Which two options exist to achieve this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
AE is correct
I Think is AE, because the DIS_REPAIR_TIME is user to delay the drop disk event, but the disk is already drop.

choices.B: Increase the value of the DISK_REPAIR_TIME attribute for the disk group.
choices.D: Decrease the value of the DISK_REPAIR_TIME attribute for the disk group.
choices.C: Use the WAIT clause with the ALTER DISKGROUP command.
choices.A: Make sure that the ASM_POWER_LIMIT parameter is set to 1 before rebalancing the disk group.
choices.E: Set the POWER clause to 1 in the ALTER DISKGROUP command.

choices.C: Transactions on database objects stored in tablespaces in the DGRP1 disk group fail.
choices.B: New allocation units are mirrored in the FG2 failure group until FG1 is restored and the disk group resynchronized.
choices.D: New allocation units are not mirrored but changes to allocation units are tracked in the FG2 failure group.
choices.A: The redundancy is lowered until the FG1 failgroup is restored and the disk group resynchronized.

comments.content: B and C are correct, because normal redundancy just supports 1 disk failure, in this case is the whole Failure Group went down.

questions.question_text:
Disk group DGRP1 has these attributes:
1. Normal redundancy
2. Two failure groups FG1 and FG2 with two disks each
3. Compatibility settings set to 12.1
The FG1 failure group goes offline due to hardware failure.
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)
